channel.title: Posts on Monica W. Gerber
channel.description: Recent content in Posts on Monica W. Gerber

item.title: A little bit of Monica in my life
item.description: One analysis in the R community that has inspired me is Hilarly Parker’s analysis of the most poisoned baby name in US history. It turns out that I also have a so-called ‘poisoned’ name, or so I thought. For a short period in grade school there was nothing I wished for more than for my name to not be what caused the adults to turn down the volumne on NPR. Its entrance into popular culture due to the Clinton Impeachment, a shoutout in Mambo No.

item.title: Hello, world!
item.description: About my work My name is Monica Gerber and I am a Biostatistician located in Boston, Massachusetts. I have worked at Massachusetts General Hospital (MGH) since January 2015, when I joined the Department of Psychiatry to work in a research group focused on population mental health. Currently, I work in General Academic Pediatrics and the Center for Community Health Improvement (CCHI). At MGH I have the pleasure of working on many research and evaluation projects.
